member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.AddBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that adds the specified number of business days to this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are added, otherwise days are subtracted.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be added to this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the sum of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.SubtractBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that subtracts the specified number of business days from this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are subtracted, otherwise days are added.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be subtracted from this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the difference of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.GetTotalBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Computes the total count of business days between two instances. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The time fraction is ignored and the returned value is inclusive.
Example 1: Friday through Tuesday = 3 business days
Example 2: Saturday through Sunday = 0 business days
member.param: The value to compare to .
The value to compare to this . can be either less or greater than this value.
member.returns: A value representing the total count of business days between two instances.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: The to read from.
An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified [] with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

The method that is called when the file needs to be updated.
member.returns: The this method creates.

member.param: A that contains the name of the file that represents the cached version. This file does not need to exist.

The method that is called when the file is accessed. If the method returns , it means the cached file is invalid and is called to update the file. If it returns , the existing file is read from the disk. This method is only called when the file on the disk exists.
The method that is called when the file needs to be updated.
member.returns: The this method creates.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.StringDistance.Levenshtein(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Measures the minimum number of single-character edits (i.e. insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other.
member.param: The first to compare.
The second to compare.
member.returns: The minimum number of single-character edits (i.e. insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other. If both strings are equal, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.StringDistance.DamerauLevenshtein(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Measures the minimum number of single-character edits (i.e. insertions, deletions, substitutions or transpositions) required to change one word into the other.
member.param: The first to compare.
The second to compare.
member.returns: The minimum number of single-character edits (i.e. insertions, deletions, substitutions or transpositions) required to change one word into the other. If both strings are equal, 0 is returned.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.StringDistance.Hamming(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Measures the minimum number of substitutions required to change one into another. The Hamming distance between two strings of equal length is the number of positions at which the corresponding characters are different.
member.param: The first to compare.
The second to compare.
member.returns: The minimum number of substitutions required to change one into another. If both strings are equal, 0 is returned.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates a random text sequence that match the pattern of real language. A is used to generate the sentences that generated text are composed of.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.SentenceGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to generate sentences.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.MinSentenceCount
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum number sentences used to build text.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.MaxSentenceCount
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number sentences used to build text.
The default value is 20

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.LineBreakChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a linebreak being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0 means no linebreaks and 1.0 means a linebreak between every sentence.
The default value is 0.0

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.ParagraphChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a paragraph being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0 means no paragraphs and 1.0 means a paragraph between every sentence. Randomly picked paragraphs have precedence over linebreaks and do not occur consecutively.
The default value is 0.1

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.#ctor(BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified and with default values ( = 10, = 20, = 0.0, = 0.1).
member.param: The to use for sentence generation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random sequence of sentences using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.returns: A new with dynamically generated text.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates random sentences that match the pattern of real language. A is used to generate the words that generated sentences are composed of.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.WordGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to generate words.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.MinWords
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum number words used to build sentences.
The default value is 3

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.MaxWords
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number words used to build sentences.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.CommaChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a comma being inserted after a word, where 0.0 means no commas and 1.0 means a comma between every word.
The default value is 0.2

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.FinishPunctuation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the characters that are used for punctuation after a sentence. Including a character multiple times increases the chance for this character. For example, this can be used to increase the likelihood of a period over a question mark or exclamation mark. Character order is not relevant.
The default value is "...?!"

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.#ctor(BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified and with default values ( = 3, = 10, = 0.2, = "...?!").
member.param: The to use for word generation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random sentence using the specified parameters of this instance.
member.returns: A new with a dynamically generated sentence.

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates random words that match the pattern of real language. Word generation is typically used to create arbitrary text that looks like language.

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator.MinLength
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum length of a generated word.
The default value is 3

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator.MaxLength
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum length of a generated word.
The default value is 10

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator.DoubleConsonantChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a consonant being inserted twice, where 0.0 means no double consonants and 1.0 means consonants are always inserted twice.
The default value is 0.1f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.WordGenerator.DoubleVovelChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a vovel being inserted twice, where 0.0 means no double vovels and 1.0 means vovels are always inserted twice.
The default value is 0.1

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.Wording.FormatTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying the two most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by a comma.
Example: "12:00:03" is converted to "12h, 3s"
member.param: The value to convert.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.Wording.FormatTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying a specified number of most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by a comma.
Example: "5.03:30:15" is converted to "5d, 3h", if is 2 and "5d, 3h, 30m", if is 3
member.param: The value to convert.
A value specifying the number of elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds to display.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Text.Wording.FormatTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Converts the value of the specified to a human readable representation by displaying a specified number of most significant elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds that are greater than zero, separated by the specified separator.
Example: "5.03:30:15" is converted to "5d, 3h", if is 2 and "5d, 3h, 30m", if is 3
member.param: The value to convert.
A value specifying the number of elements of either days, hours, minutes or seconds to display.
A specifying the separator to use between each element, including whitespaces, if needed.
member.returns: The value of the specified as a human readable representation.

member.summary:
Validates a that is a MAC address in EUI-48 or EUI-64 format. When this method returns, a [] is stored in , representing the parsed address bytes.
Allowed formats are: 000000000000, 00:00:00:00:00:00, 00-00-00-00-00-00, 000.000.000.000 and 0000.0000.0000 for EUI-48; and 0000000000000000, 00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00, 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00 and 0000.0000.0000.0000 for EUI-64.
member.param: The to be validated.
When this method returns, contains the address bytes as a [].
member.returns: , if validation of succeeded; otherwise, .

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming
member.summary: Specifies the naming convention of a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.CSharp
member.summary:
The namespace is omitted and the C# type name is used for built-in types.
Examples: int, DateTime

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.TypeName
member.summary:
The namespace is omitted and the .NET Framework type name is used.
Examples: Int32, DateTime

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.TypeNaming.FullName
member.summary:
The full type name including namespace is used.
Examples: System.Int32, System.DateTime

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format for a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Default
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits.
Example: 00000000000000000000000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hyphens
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens.
Example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Braces
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces.
Example: {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Parentheses
member.summary:
The is displayed using 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses.
Example: (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.GuidFormat.Hexadecimal
member.summary:
The is displayed with four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces.
Example: {0x00000000,0x0000,0x0000,{0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00}}

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.StringCasing
member.summary: Specifies the character casing of a .

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.Lower
member.summary:
The is lowercase.
Example: hello world

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.Upper
member.summary:
The is uppercase.
Example: HELLO WORLD

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.CamelCase
member.summary:
The is camel case, where the first character and each character following a whitespace or punctuation mark is uppercase. All other characters are lowercase.
Example: Hello World

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.LowerSnakeCase
member.summary:
The is snake case. All characters are lowercase. Punctuation marks are removed and sequences of one or multiple whitespace characters are replaced by a single underscore.
Example: hello_world

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.UpperSnakeCase
member.summary:
The is snake case. All characters are uppercase. Punctuation marks are removed and sequences of one or multiple whitespace characters are replaced by a single underscore.
Example: HELLO_WORLD

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.LowerKebabCase
member.summary:
The is kebab case. All characters are lowercase. Punctuation marks are removed and sequences of one or multiple whitespace characters are replaced by a single dash.
Example: hello-world

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.StringCasing.UpperKebabCase
member.summary:
The is kebab case. All characters are uppercase. Punctuation marks are removed and sequences of one or multiple whitespace characters are replaced by a single dash.
Example: HELLO-WORLD
